intro: Hemisteptia lyrata, commonly known as the lyrata hemisteptia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open woodlands. Hemisteptia lyrata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
